channel.title: Current team members on Cooperstone Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Current team members on Cooperstone Lab

item.title: Jordan (JL) Hartman
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2019-present Research focus: Understanding the metabolic and sensory contexts of breeding for high alpha-tomatine. Background: B.S. Biology, Wingate University, M.S. Horticultural Science, North Carolina State University Hometown: Salisbury, NC Non-work interests: Contact: hartman dot 635 at osu dot edu

item.title: Maria Sholola
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science & Technology Years in the lab: 2020-present Research focus: Understanding absorption, metabolism, and bioactivity of tomato and soy phytochemicals. Background: B.S. Chemistry, Loyola University, Chicago, IL Hometown: Chicago, IL, USA Non-work interests: dancing (urban, Afrobeats, and more recently ballet), running and biking scenic routes (hasn’t found one that tops Chicago’s lakefront trail yet), and traveling. Contact: sholola dot one at osu dot edu Links: Google scholar profile Twitter

item.title: Daniel Quiroz Moreno
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2021-present Research focus: Multi-omic integration for crop nutritional improvement, with a focus on developing informatic tools. Background: B.S. Biotechnology, Ikiam University, Tena, Ecuador Hometown: Riobamba, Ecuador Non-work interests: Photography, mountain biking Contact: quirozmoreno dot 1 at osu dot edu Personal webpage: https://danielquiroz97.gitlab.io Developed Mass Spectrometry tools: MS2extract: R library to construct in-house MS/MS libraries, facilitating advanced mass spectrometry analysis.

item.title: Daniel Do
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science and Technology Years in the lab: 2021-present Research focus: Elucidating the in vivo relevance of tomato steroidal alkaloids: an understanding of their absorption, metabolism, accumulation, and bioefficacy Background: B.S. Chemistry, Stockton University, Galloway, NJ Hometown: Galloway, NJ, USA Non-work interests: running, cooking, climbing, roller skating Contact: do dot 226 at osu dot edu

item.title: Lydia Balogh
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2022-present Research focus: Apple improvement using genomics, metabolomics, and sensory science Background: B.S. Biology, minor in English Language and Literature, University of Western Ontario, Canada Hometown: London, Ontario, Canada Non-work interests: Contact: balogh dot 67 at osu dot edu Links: Twitter

item.title: Aaron Wiedemer
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science & Technology Years in the lab: 2022-present Research focus: Background: B.S. Food Science, minor Jazz Performance, Penn State University, University Park, PA Hometown: Chatham, NJ, USA Non-work interests: Contact: wiedemer dot 7 at osu dot edu Links: Google scholar profile Twitter

item.title: Victória Hermes de Vargas
item.description: --- Degree: Ph.D. Program: Chemical Engineering, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul Years in the lab: 2024-present Research focus: Understanding chemical changes resulting from application of novel processing technologies using metabolomics Background: Hometown: Non-work interests: Contact: hermesdevargas dot 1 at osu dot edu

item.title: Bryce Reiter
item.description: Degree: B.S. Program: Chemistry Years in the lab: 2024-present Hometown: Republic, OH, USA Non-work interests: hiking, reading, and cooking Contact: reiter dot 121 at osu dot edu

item.title: Nacho (Cooperstone)
item.description: Degree: Working on basic obedience Years in the lab: 2018-present Areas of focus: Snoring during Zooms, rolling around in the dirt after a bath, eating cheese. Hometown: Columbus, OH Interests: splooting, taking walks as long as its not too hot, cheese
